newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: National Bank NZ launches passive investment fund.
newsitem.headline: National Bank NZ launches passive investment fund.

text.p: The National Bank of New Zealand Financial Services, the bank's retail provider of unit trust and superannuation funds, said on Thursday it had added a range of passive products to the active investement products already offered to retail customers.
Southpac, fund manager for NBFS, will offer wholesale clients an active asset service, while adopting indexed stock selection within individual sectors.
Southpac will continue to manage existing unit trust funds suitable for the retail investor on an active basis for NBFS.
The intent will be to provide leading investment performance for all active products, in particular New Zealand and Australian sharemarket trusts.
National Bank said its retail superannuation scheme would follow Southpac's wholesale approach. The scheme will retain active asset allocation with passive management within the sectors.
